abstract: The chief of Duke Energy told regulators that the board had a list of worries about the man chosen to preside over the newly merged utility.
snippet: The chief of Duke Energy told regulators that the board had a list of worries about the man chosen to preside over the newly merged utility.
lead_paragraph: RALEIGH, N.C. — An accumulation of concerns caused Duke Energy’s board to lose confidence in its chief executive, leading to his ouster just hours after completing a $32 billion merger with Progress Energy, according to testimony Tuesday by the man who replaced him.

headline.main: Duke Energy’s Chief Defends Abrupt Dismissal of His Predecessor
headline.print_headline: Duke Energy’s Chief Defends Abrupt Dismissal of His Predecessor
